document_data.name: Darkfire
document_data.mainbody: '''''Darkfire''''' was a [[divine magic|divine]] [[necromancy]] [[spell]] from the [[combat sphere|combat]] and [[necromantic sphere]]s that shot black flames from the caster's eyes and hands.
document_data.Effects: When the spell was cast, oily black flames erupted from the caster's hands. Atypical of normal fire, ''darkfire'' was cool to the touch and did not ignite flammable items or objects. It was harmful to living people or creatures and actually healed the [[undead]]. With regards to the undead, ''darkfire'' could be used to reattach severed body parts by placing them into position and bathing them in the fire.
document_data.Components: In addition to [[Verbal component|verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s, this spell required a pinch of ash that was formed by the cremation of a mammalian creature.
document_data.History: The specifications of ''darkfire'' were inscribed within the [[Beshaba]]n [[relic]], ''[[the Black Book]]''.
